results.title: Farmyard stories = better move on frog ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers in a farmyard setting and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. The stories are: “Mrs. Mopple’s washing line”, “Sophie and Jack”, “Better move on frog”, “Teddy at the seaside”, “Bookload of animals”, “Mr. Ginger’s potato”, “Wilberforce goes on a picnic”, “Ambo and the little elephant”, “Peter Pipers at the wildlife park”, “Hairy Mclary from Donaldson’s dairy” Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: [Individual motivation and behavior]
results.creator_credit: Russell Morasi, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Deals with individual motivation and behaviour in groups, explaining why people join groups and why some members block or dominate group action. Presents a demonstration and discusses the motivation of each participant in the demonstration.

results.title: Teatime stories = The House that Jack built and nine other teatime stories
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. Stories include Super Adam and Rosie Wonder, Ahhh! said Jack, Apple tree, The House that Jack built, The Smallest turtle, Seaside Christmas tree, Donkey’s tale, Peter Piper’s birthday party, Peepbo!, Wilberforce goes shopping. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: The Anatomy of a group
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Illustrates the structure of a group, the goals to be achieved during meetings, participation patterns, the quality of communication, group standards, and group procedures. Discusses the difference between a collection of individuals and a group, and the means of getting a new group off to a good start.
results.description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.

Discusses the difference between a collection of individuals and a group, and the means of getting a new group off to a good start.

results.title: Sharing the Leadership
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Explores three categories of individual action and their relation to group leadership: self-serving functions, task functions and group serving functions.

results.title: Dodo in Pukcab Land
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo saves the day for the absent-minded Professor Fingers when he diverts the train the Professor is travelling on from a collision - only problem is DoDo diverts the train into Pukcab Land where everything is backwards. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo helps Interpol
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps Interpol catch card cheats on an ocean liner. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 52 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps the inhabitants on the planet Laugh/Cry who are under threat of invasion by inhabitants of another planet known as the Touchies. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.
